com.bitwise.decaf.editor.grammar
Class Grammar

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--org.hs.generator.GConstruct
        |
        +--com.bitwise.decaf.editor.grammar.CodeNode
              |
              +--com.bitwise.decaf.editor.grammar.Grammar
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, org.hs.util.Copy, Decaf, at.dms.compiler.PhylumListener, com.bitwise.decaf.editor.ReferenceListener, com.bitwise.decaf.editor.ScopeReference, Serializable, Utils.Renderable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Phrase, Sentence
public abstract class Grammar
extends CodeNode
implements Utils.Renderable

Grammar is a secondary base class of CodeNode, representing both Phrase and Sentence. It keeps a #content member that implements the Grammar.Content interface, and maintains state in three boolean statuses:

1) blue, when it contains errors
2) hasFocus, when its content editor has focus
3) perking, when in the Percolator

A collection of Officer, known as the Beat, is maintained by each Grammar instance; the officers in turn maintain the Grammar's blue, status. Grammar is responsible for rendering its contents, and it limits Grammar editor windows to a single concurrent instance.

See Also:
Serialized Form
